1.name: King Kong
1.description: A film crew goes to a tropical island for an exotic location shoot and discovers a colossal ape who takes a shine to their female blonde star. He is then captured and brought back to New York City for public exhibition.

2.name: Das Testament des Dr. Mabuse
2.description: A new crime wave grips the city and all clues seem to lead to the nefarious Dr. Mabuse, even though he has been imprisoned in a mental asylum for nearly a decade.

3.name: The Invisible Man
3.description: A scientist finds a way of becoming invisible, but in doing so, he becomes murderously insane.

4.name: Ekstase
4.description: Eva has just gotten married to an older gentleman, but discovers that he is obsessed with order in his life and doesn't have much room for passion. She becomes despondent and leaves him, ...                See full summary »

5.name: Duck Soup
5.description: Rufus T. Firefly is named president/dictator of bankrupt Freedonia and declares war on neighboring Sylvania over the love of wealthy Mrs. Teasdale.

6.name: Baby Face
6.description: A young woman, sexually exploited all her life, decides to turn the tables and exploit the hapless men at a big city bank - by gleefully sleeping her way to the top.

7.name: Dinner at Eight
7.description: Affluent Millicent and Oliver Jordan throw a dinner for a handful of wealthy and/or well-born acquaintances, each of whom has much to reveal.

8.name: Dancing Lady
8.description: An attractive dancer is rescued from jail by a rich man, who helps her to have her first big opportunity at a musical play on Broadway.

9.name: Little Women
9.description: A chronicle of the lives of a group of sisters growing up in nineteenth-century America.

10.name: 42nd Street
10.description: A director puts on what may be his last Broadway show and, at the last moment, a naive newcomer has to replace the star.

11.name: Queen Christina
11.description: Queen Christina of Sweden is a popular monarch who is loyal to her country. However, when she falls in love with a Spanish envoy, she must choose between the throne and the man she loves.

12.name: Sons of the Desert
12.description: When Stan and Ollie trick their wives into thinking that they are taking a medicinal cruise while they're actually going to a convention, the wives find out the truth the hard way.

13.name: Footlight Parade
13.description: Chester Kent struggles against time, romance, and a rival's spy to produce spectacular live "prologues" for movie houses.

14.name: The Private Life of Henry VIII.
14.description: King Henry VIII marries five more times after his divorce from his first wife Catherine of Aragon.

15.name: Cavalcade
15.description: The triumphs and tragedies of two English families, the upper-crust Marryots and the working-class Bridges, from 1899 to 1933 are portrayed.

16.name: Gold Diggers of 1933
16.description: A wealthy composer rescues unemployed Broadway performers with a new play.

17.name: She Done Him Wrong
17.description: In the Gay Nineties, a seductive nightclub singer contends with several suitors, including a jealous escaped convict and a handsome temperance league member.

18.name: Bombshell
18.description: Sexpot film star Lola Burns seeks a new image and tries marrying a marquis and adopting a baby - all sorts of schemes which go awry.

19.name: The Story of Temple Drake
19.description: A wealthy but neurotic Southern belle finds herself trapped in the hideout of a gang of vicious bootleggers. The gang's leader lusts after her, and is determined not to let anything stand in the way of his having her.

20.name: Roman Scandals
20.description: A kind-hearted young man is thrown out of his corrupt home town of West Rome, Oklahoma. He falls asleep and dreams that he is back in the days of olden Rome, where he gets mixed up with court intrigue and a murder plot against the Emperor.

21.name: Mystery of the Wax Museum
21.description: The disappearance of people and corpses leads a reporter to a wax museum and a sinister sculptor.

22.name: Design for Living
22.description: A woman cannot decide between two men who love her, and the trio agree to try living together in a platonic friendly relationship.

23.name: I'm No Angel
23.description: Circus performer Tira seeks a better life pursuing the company of wealthy New York men with improbable comic complications along the way.

24.name: Morning Glory
24.description: When a naively innocent, aspiring actress arrives on the Broadway scene, she is taken under the wing of several theater veterans who mentor her to ultimate success.

25.name: Wild Boys of the Road
25.description: In the depths of the Depression, two teenage boys strike out on their own in order to help their struggling parents and find life on the road tougher than expected.

26.name: Alice in Wonderland
26.description: In Victorian England a bored young girl dreams that she has entered a fantasy world called Wonderland populated by even more fantastic characters.

27.name: Flying Down to Rio
27.description: An aviator and band leader who is always getting his group fired for his flirtatious behavior with the female guests soon finds himself falling for an engaged woman.

28.name: The Son of Kong
28.description: The men who captured the giant ape King Kong return to Skull Island and find his likewise gigantic but far more friendly son.

29.name: State Fair
29.description: An Iowa family finds adventure, love, and heartbreak, when they spend a week at the state fair.

30.name: Tarzan the Fearless
30.description: In the African Jungle, a group of Europeans come across the fabled white man who was raised by apes. Tarzan takes an immediate liking to the blond Mary Brooks and rescues her during a nasty...                See full summary »

31.name: Lady for a Day
31.description: A gangster tries to make Apple Annie, the Times Square apple seller, a lady for a day.

32.name: Christopher Strong
32.description: A famous female flier and a member of Parliament drift into a potentially disastrous affair.

33.name: The Kennel Murder Case
33.description: Philo Vance, accompanied by his prize-losing Scottish terrier, investigates the locked-room murder of a prominent and much-hated collector whose broken Chinese vase provides an important clue.

34.name: The Eagle and the Hawk
34.description: The pilots of a Royal Air Force squadron in World War I face not only physical but mental dangers in their struggle to survive while fighting the enemy.

35.name: The Three Musketeers
35.description: Tom Wayne rescues Clancy, Renard and Schmidt in the Arabian desert and they join him in going after El Shaitan, a bad guy who is never seen as he tries to wipe out the Foreign Legion.

36.name: The Ghoul
36.description: An Egyptologist returns from the dead to take revenge on those who have violated his tomb.

37.name: The Vampire Bat
37.description: When corpses drained of blood begin to show up in a European village, vampirism is suspected to be responsible.

38.name: Riders of Destiny
38.description: Bad guy Kincaid controls the local water supply and plans to do in the other ranchers. Government agent Saunders shows up undercover to do in Kincaid and win the heart of one of his victims Fay Denton.

39.name: Deluge
39.description: A massive earthquake strikes the United States, which destroys the West Coast and unleashes a massive flood that threatens to destroy the East Coast as well.

40.name: Ex-Lady
40.description: Although free spirit Helen Bauer does not believe in marriage, she consents to marry Don, but his infidelities cause her to also take on a lover.

41.name: Okraina
41.description: Outskirts is an internationally renowned masterpiece of early sound cinema. In a remote Russian village during World War I, colorful and nuanced characters experience divided loyalties: ...                See full summary »

42.name: The Devil's Brother
42.description: Two wannabe bandits join the service of a dashing nobleman, who secretly masquerades as Fra Diavolo, a notorious outlaw.

43.name: The Song of Songs
43.description: Lily falls in love with the sculptor who leaves her out of fear of commitment.

44.name: Our Betters
44.description: Although the British upper class may be thought our betters in society, but they are certainly not our betters, and perhaps our equals, in morality.

45.name: Sagebrush Trail
45.description: Imprisoned for a murder he did not commit, John Brant escapes and ends up out west where, after giving the local lawmen the slip, he joins up with an outlaw gang. Brant finds out that '...                See full summary »

46.name: The Bowery
46.description: "In the Gay Nineties New York had grown up into bustles and balloon Sleeves ... but The Bowery had grown younger, louder and more rowdy until it was known as the 'Livest Mile on the face of...                See full summary »

47.name: Le testament du Dr. Mabuse
47.description: French version of the German movie Das Testament des Dr. Mabuse (1933). Both movies were directed simultaneously by Fritz Lang in Germany.

48.name: Lady Killer
48.description: A former gangster makes it big in Hollywood, but his old life catches up with him.

49.name: A Study in Scarlet
49.description: In London, a secret society led by lawyer Thaddeus Merrydew collects the assets of any of its deceased members and divides them among the remaining members. Society members start dropping ...                See full summary »

50.name: The Woman Accused
50.description: During a three-day pleasure cruise, a murder victim's friend (John Halliday) tries to trick a new bride (Nancy Carroll) into admitting her guilt.
